address: Xã Kon Pne, Huyện KBang, Tỉnh Gia Lai
thought:
**Deconstructing an Old Vietnamese Address**

Okay, so I've got this old Vietnamese address, "Xã Kon Pne, Tỉnh Gia Lai," and I need to figure out its modern equivalent.  My first step is always to break it down.  I identify "Xã Kon Pne" as the ward and "Tỉnh Gia Lai" as the province.  Gotta confirm the obvious – checking if "Gia Lai" experienced any province-level mergers.  Looks like it was briefly considered, but ultimately remained "Gia Lai."  Good.

Now comes the fun part: diving into those resolutions.  I specifically hunt for "Xã Kon Pne."  And, bingo!  Resolution 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15 catches my eye.  Line 67 seals the deal: "Xã Kon Pne" and "Xã Đak Rong" are being combined to form the new "Xã Đak Rong".  Perfect.

Next, I need to validate this with the "New Wards" data.  I look for "Xã Đak Rong" and, sure enough, there it is:  `{"ward_code":"23644","ward_name":"Xã Đak Rong","province_name":"Tỉnh Gia Lai"}`.

Time to construct the output! I've got a high degree of confidence since the resolution explicitly addresses the old ward.  The output will be: the citation from the resolution, high confidence, the province name "Gia Lai", the ward code "23644", and the ward name "Xã Đak Rong".  That should be a clean, accurate, and confidently mapped result.

citation.header: 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Gia Lai
citation.line: 67. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của xã Kon Pne và xã Đak Rong thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Đak Rong.
